required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1 and Resistance Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Recovery After Moderate-Heavy Resistance Exercise in Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1-patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the response after one bout of moderate-heavy resistance exercise in patients suffering from Myotonic Dystrophy type 1. There is still doubt about if these patients could benefit from resistance exercise, or if this mode of exercise is detrimental to their mobility and health. We aim to monitor the subjects during the recovery phase and investigate recovery in several ways.

detailed_description.textblock:
Myotonic dystrophy type 1 (DM1) is an autosomal, dominantly inherited, muscular disease and the most common muscular dystrophy amongst adults. The disease is characterized by progressive myopathy and myotonia, first evident in the distal parts of the body: calves and forearms, further progressing towards proximal parts. A recent review by Voet and co-workers (2013) concludes that exercise is safe for DM1-patients, and based on our current knowledge, DM1-patients should be able to gain positive adaptations from exercise. However, the physiological outcomes of an exercise stimulus are not well studied in this population and because of alterations in important Ca2+ handling systems the recovery processes might be significantly different from healthy muscles.
The aim of this study is to investigate the acute responses to moderate-heavy resistance exercise in DM1-patients. We aim to establish a timeline for recovery of muscle strength, measured as maximal voluntary contraction. In line with this, we want to investigate if any muscular damage has occurred with both direct and indirect measures, and possible mechanisms leading to muscle damage, i.e. impaired Ca2+ handling.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants in both groups (patients and control) perform unilateral leg resistance exercise, contralateral leg serves as control

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 5 minutes, 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, and 71 hours after exercise

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of muscle protein synthesis in m. vastus lateralis between baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of muscle protein breakdown in m. vastus lateralis between baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
other_outcome.description: Myofibrillar disruption and necrosis observed in muscle tissue samples from m. vastus lateralis with electron microscopy

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
other_outcome.description: Appearance of macrophages, satellite cell localization, and disruption of membrane in single muscle fibers and cross-sections using confocal microscopy

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
other_outcome.description: Calcium cycling in muscle tissue samples from m. vastus lateralis

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
other_outcome.description: Assessment of contractile function in single muscle fibers from m. vastus lateralis

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
other_outcome.description: Levels of protein and phosphorylation status using Western blotting
Fiber type composition in samples from m. vastus lateralis

other_outcome.time_frame: 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
other_outcome.description: Fiber type composition in samples from m. vastus lateralis

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
other_outcome.description: Localization and expression of heat shock proteins using Western blotting and Immunohistochemistry

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
other_outcome.description: Expression and phosphorylation status of central mediators in anabolic signaling pathways using Western blotting

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 27 hours after final session of resistance exercise
other_outcome.description: Expression and phosphorylation status of central mediators in pathways regulating muscle protein breakdown using Western blotting

other_outcome.measure: Change in biomarkers of muscle damage
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, 71 hours, and 96 hours after exercise
other_outcome.description: Levels of serum Creatine kinase, Myoglobin, and Troponin I

other_outcome.measure: Change in biomarker of muscle damage
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 20 hours, 44 hours, 68 hours, and 92 hours after exercise
other_outcome.description: Level of titin-N fragment in urine
Electrical stimulation of m. vastus lateralis and m. vastus medialis at 10, 20, 50, and 80 Hz
Muscle stiffness measured with shear wave elastography in static and dynamic conditions

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, and 71 hours after exercise
other_outcome.description: Subjective rating of muscle soreness using a visual analogue scale (0-10)

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, and 71 hours after exercise
other_outcome.description: Thickness of m. vastus lateralis using ultrasound B-mode

arm_group.description: Moderate-heavy resistance exercise of one leg in DM1-patients
Control leg (i.e. no exercise) in DM1-patients
Moderate-heavy resistance exercise of one leg in healthy participants
Control leg (i.e. no exercise) in healthy participants

intervention.description: Leg press: 3 x 8 repetitions at 75% of 1 repetition maximum, 3 minutes rest between sets. Knee extension: 3 x 6 repetitions at 85% of 1 repetition maximum, 3 minutes rest between sets.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed Myotonic Dystrophy type 1-diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-ambulatory
- Injuries to muscle-skeletal-system that prevents resistance exercise
- Severe affection of the cardiovascular system
- Cognitive affection
- Lives more than one hour from test site
